website_summaries.verdict: Nice option for people looking for a wide-angle lens with a zoom range. Specialty lens for certain types of photos.
pros: Wide-angle focal length range is not common in a zoom lens
Quiet auto-focus motor for recording video
Precise lens for specialty photos, although max focal length (18mm) will work for some everyday photo opportunities
cons: No telephoto capabilities in this lens
Wide-angle lenses tend to cause distortion in lines

customer_reviews.title: Fine lens... very happy
customer_reviews.text: Special purchase because I was headed back to Horseshoe Bend just below Page Arizona. Fantastic results...
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bell

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is AMAZING. It was easily the best decision for an inexpensive wide angle. I'm a photographer that is pretty hard on my equipment. Don't let the plastic fool you. It's durable, sturdy and I couldn't be happier with it. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: You will never say, for this price and zoom range, "...but the other lens could be better"
customer_reviews.text: ... because the other is not better in this zoom range and price range. I bought this lens only for some specific pics I needed, and I was actually pleasantly surprised. REMEMBER to turn the camera's peripheral light correction ON (it's a setting in the menu). Tests by professionals have it frequently as the best in its category/price. IF you need a very wide lens, one of the best choices. Four stars for missing a better manual focus for night photography. But it does focus perfectly with very little light, as long as you have enough contrast.
customer_reviews.author: Eleftherios Kritikakis

customer_reviews.title: By far my favorite lens. Was hesitant about purchasing this lens
customer_reviews.text: By far my favorite lens. Was hesitant about purchasing this lens, but I went through with it and I'm glad I did. Delivers a Very sharp image with minimal distortion and chromatic aberration. Excellent lens for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hussein Kain

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Lens is crystal clear during the day with great IQ. It's truly a wide angle, not fisheye, with straight lines barely distorted on the edges (Canon fixes this completely in software). Night photography worked! The fact I could use this at night at all xceeded my expectations. It's not a night lens and would never be ideal for night photography, but worked in a pinch fine. IS, USM, and AF just put a cherry ok top at this price point for a Canon lens.
customer_reviews.author: Mr E

customer_reviews.title: Real Estate Agents - It's worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about getting this for my Canon T3i as I was wanting a few more feet in my exposures for interior photos for my real estate business. If any agent is thinking about it, you'll be pleasantly surprised with the additional angle of view. I use Lightroom to correct the perspective distortion and it whips the photo into great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Like most of the other comments on here saying about ...
customer_reviews.text: Like most of the other comments on here saying about hesitating in purchasing this lens, I too thought twice before purchasing and was actually thinking in buying a pricier one. But let me tell you, I absolutely love this lens! I haven't tested out the other higher end ones, but this one so far gets the job done! No regrets! About my pictures, most of them are low quality because I'm writing this from my other computer and I dont have the higher resolution pics here, but just so you can get an idea of what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super lens and exceptional value
customer_reviews.text: In 2019, still an awesome value for such a low cost lens. Love the way the images come out of my Canon 7d Mark II. If you are in need of solid wide angle lens, this one is it. Search out Ken Rockwell's review on Google. After reading that I had no hesitation to buy this lens. Super happy as I am about to embark on a month long trip.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Page

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this lens if you have a crop sensor Canon camera and want to do landscape/real estate/or artsy wide stuff! Definitely not the sharpest lens, but you get what you pay for at this level. The auto focus works very well though! and it's very light. Wish it opened up a little wider, but I don't expect it to at this price point. Not a low light lens, but if you have a tripod then this will be a fun long exposure lense for wide star shots or any landscape type work.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy J

customer_reviews.title: Heavy vignette, otherwise delightful.
customer_reviews.text: It's a 16mm-28mm (equivalent) wideangle for $300. 16mm rectilinear images don't come this cheap anywhere else. +Sharpness +Autofocus speed (also: silent) +Image stabilization +I haven't broken it yet -It has a teensy bit of barrel distortion (cry about it) and the vignetting is pretty heavy at f/4.5 (it's already well controlled at f/5.6) -Performance at 18mm is pretty weak. Just use it as a 10mm prime. Very impressed. I bought a Canon just so I could use this lens and I don't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: camera user

customer_reviews.title: Totes Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this lens. It doesn't zoom in or out much, but for someone who is just starting out as a vlogger, it's perfect for capturing my face and including people who I am socializing with. The wide angle is perfect not only for video but also capturing some really awesome images when doing photography. The Image Stabilization is a blessing and I like being able to switch the autofocus when I'm filming and shutting it off when taking photos.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Dimas

customer_reviews.title: A great wide angle zoom when you're on a budget
customer_reviews.text: A great wide angle zoom when you're on a budget. Build quality is good, but it is mostly plastic and very light. Image quality for me has been quite good. It is a bit slow and needs plenty of light, but that's not usually a problem outdoors. It does suffer a bit from flair. If you already have the 18-55 STM and the 55-250 STM, this is a good addition to complete a set of decent and affordable lenses for both stills and video.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Photos Like Never Before
customer_reviews.text: This lens is incredible. Perfect clarity, super quiet autofocus, and very little distortion. I ordered mine for a trip to the Redwoods, and it in no way disappointed, and in fact exceeded all expectations. I took photos like I'd never taken before, and the wide angle of the lens captured each and every monumental detail of the magnificent landscape. I would definitely recommend to anybody shooting in crowded forested or city areas looking to get the most out of your pictures.
customer_reviews.author: David Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: SUPER FAST focus and it is so quiet that I ...
customer_reviews.text: SUPER FAST focus and it is so quiet that I thought it was broken at first. Images are super clear with great detail. Extremely light and the fact that this has image stabilization makes it work in very low light without having to push the ISO. I almost bought the 10-22 but am glad that I found this due to Ken Rockwell's review. The price is great, the lens is light, the lens is fast, and it has image stabilization. Couldn't ask for more except constant aperture. Great job on this lens Canon. Look forward to others built on this same foundation. Paid $279
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Polen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this lens. Using with a Canon 60D. Honestly, a steal at this price. Was in London a few weeks back and was able to easily get some breathtaking shots.
customer_reviews.author: skim15

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for landscape photography
customer_reviews.text: For landscape photography especially architecture this lens is perfect. I bought this before a trip to Europe and the images I shot were so worth the nominal price for this lens. I’m an amateur photographer and love taking shots of gothic buildings, churches, scenery, etc. This lens is perfect for my needs. This is not a portrait lens however. It’s better for pictures of landscapes or real estate.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Great for real estate
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens for real estate HDR shots. It is not an L series by any means- I wish it was faster and didn't feel so lightweight and plasticy but it is what it is- but for my purposes it does the job. Also really cheap on Canon's part that you don't get the lens hood.
customer_reviews.author: MogoreTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very quiet! Compared to the lenses that came with my Canon Rebel T5, this one makes very little sound in auto-focus mode. (Though I do prefer to use manual mode on my lenses). I almost thought there was something wrong with it because I’m so used to the “whirrrr” sound the others make. I haven’t fully explored what this lens can do, but the little I’ve done to just play around with it has left me impressed and excited to see what my adventures with it will accomplish.
customer_reviews.author: kiki1298

customer_reviews.title: It's wide angle allows for the perfect distance needed to capture the up close action
customer_reviews.text: My go to lens for vlogging and documenting everything. It's wide angle allows for the perfect distance needed to capture the up close action. Definitely doesn't have range, but that's why you use multiple lenses in your kit.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Johnson

customer_reviews.title: For the price, I do not believe this wide angle can be beat!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I do not believe this wide angle can be beat! I was using it on a Canon T3 (since been stolen along with the lens), but I'd buy it again if I could. As soon as you start using it, it is near impossible to go back to your old lenses for landscapes and such. The chromatic aberration at the edges of the photos is a small concern, BUT, the feature designed to remove that in editing programs works very well, along with handling the other distortions that come from using a wide angle. So in conclusion, absolutely buy the lens, but have your correction software ready for a quick easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Maalvus

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I don't use or need wide angle lenses much, but it is nice to have one for the times I need one. This isn't the greatest lens, but it filled a gap I had in my camera bag without breaking the bank. If you are looking for that extreme fish eye barrel distortion, this isn't it. It is distorted, but not much. On the flip side if you don't want any distortion, this does have some.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wide angle shots for a decent priced lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wide angle shots for a decent priced lens. While flaring doesn't occur easily, it is something you have to watch for. However, I have found even just minor adjustments in angle will get rid of the flare. This lens stayed on a second body on a trip to Europe, and was great for huge ancient buildings (I love architecture) that were so close in proximity to each other, or on narrow streets, that even my 18-200 travel lens (on my primary camera body) could not capture the whole building. This lens gave me some great shots. This is not a professional lens, but it is a great hobbyist lens. Was definitely a good buy for travel.
customer_reviews.author: DCC

customer_reviews.title: Great little lens will worth it better than the L ...
customer_reviews.text: Great little lens will worth it better than the L lens for cheaper price L lens has no Auto focus
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Woodward

customer_reviews.title: ALL MY WORLD'S A STAGE
customer_reviews.text: This lens with my Canon EOS 80D, is perfect for low light shots in the theatre! (I am a theatrical set designer)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Popiel

customer_reviews.title: Great lens! Used with Canon Rebel t4i and now use on a Panasonic G7 with adapter.
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but amazing results with this lens. It can get some impressively wide angles with minimal distortion and no noticeable Chromatic Aberration. Making the switch to 4K video with Panasonic, this lens has become my go-to for breathtaking wide shots.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron H.

customer_reviews.title: Really captures the room
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for real estate photography. Photos are still good quality as the 18-35mm lens that came with my camera. Rebel ti5 never ceases to disappoint. This lens really captures the whole room. Perfect for real estate photos.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Stop shopping, get this lens and start making money or just having fun
customer_reviews.text: Silent auto focus in Video mode, using on my fantastic Canon 80D . I Returned the 24mm in favor of this lens. Since we are using a crop sensor the angle of coverage is greater than 10-18 which is 16 to 29 in the old 35mm film lingo. So a very nice sharp wide angle. I also have a 35mm 1.8 prime which is really closer to 50mm so that is my standard. Great lens for those of you who like videoing yourself Vlog?
customer_reviews.author: 68EagleTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: You can easily carry it around for hours
customer_reviews.text: Fun, Fun, Fun. This lens is awesome. It's super light. Add it to the Canon 80d and it's a nice light rig. You can easily carry it around for hours and not get tired. It's that light. Oh yeah, it's also quick to focus for those vloggers out there. It produces a great picture. I especially like all that I can capture with this thing because it is so wide. That makes it a lot of fun to shoot on. Very cool in the wide open, on city streets, in tight rooms/spaces. Have fun with it. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia HayesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: 10mm just allows you to capture so much more
customer_reviews.text: I know it doesn't seem like there should be a big difference between an 18mm and 10mm but it was surprising. I live in a coastal area and take a lot of sunrise/sunset photos. The 10mm side of this lens lets me capture more of the sky which can be dramatic and make a dramatic difference in the end result of the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Jacek

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had the opportunity to go anywhere nice and take pics yet but I'm already satisfied with ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the opportunity to go anywhere nice and take pics yet but I'm already satisfied with this lens! I tried my hand at astrophotography last night in my backyard and am very pleased with the results. I could only see a few stars and just kind of pointed up and hoped for the best and actually managed to catch a bit of the milky way! This with a ton of light pollution. First image is straight from the camera and other two are cropped from the first and color manipulated. I used this lens with a 70d body.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for Real Estate photography.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lens. I bought this to shoot real estate and I've been very happy. It's wide enough for small rooms and the zoom lets me get it just right. My images are tack sharp. The base being plastic means I have to take more care with it than other "L" lens, but I didn't pay $1000 for it either!! I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: WM5E

customer_reviews.title: Great for Wide Angle Shots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Real Estate Interior pictures and it gets the job done, worth every penny !
customer_reviews.author: ricardo garcia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a fantastic value and gives great image quality. If you need an ultra wide lens for landscape photography on a APS-c (crop frame) camera, then this is the ticket for you. It's not the fastests lens, so I wouldn't recommend it for astrophotography, but for general landscape photography it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Roderick C Best

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ultra wide angle - get the whole rainbow at 10mm.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens. Skip the 10-22mm, I bought that too and returned it. This is just a sharp and I am a pixel peeper. The only thing is this lens make a slightly warmer white balance at 10mm than the 10-22; Fix that in post processing if you feel the need. Distortion is the same as the 10-22, you notice it at 10mm, goes away completely by 14mm. 18mm looks the same as my kit lens at 18mm, only the kit has a lower f-stop at 18mm.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great for real estate pictures
customer_reviews.text: I am a REALTOR and use this lens to take pictures of homes. This lens is perfect to cover a whole room in one shot. The only thing I would recommend is taking pictures in bright daylight or with good lighting. If this is not an option, I recommend getting some kind of additional flashlight for the camera. The reason for it is that sometimes, the flashlight that the camera already has creates a darker spot in a picture. It is easily avoided thought with natural light of lots of lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Viktoriya

customer_reviews.title: Great wide angle lens for crop sensors
customer_reviews.text: Great wide angle lens for crop sensors! Motor is extremely fast and completely silent. Sharp images. Perfect for well lit outdoor images. Lens does not perform well in low light situations due to the aperture. The IS helps, but it's still near impossible to get a good shot indoors in dimly lit conditions. Still, this is not why I purchased the lens so I knew this when I ordered. I would order again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Rob BTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice photographer, added this lens to standard and telephoto package I'd bought last year. It's easy to use, has a unique wide-angle capture that separates from my other 2 options, and makes an ideal 3-lens-package for my sporting events, family gathering, and nature photography needs.
customer_reviews.author: BT4

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE!! My husband surprised me with a trip to England & Paris for our 10yr anniversary and I needed a wide angle lens- this did the job!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Get this lens NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Really great value for the money. The stepper motor used for focusing is so quiet I thought at first that it was broken..... but it's not, it works quickly and silently. The build quality is just fine for a Polycarbonate body. Very high quality and VERY light. I like that. The lens is exceedingly sharp. Is it the fastest lens out there? NO. But who cares for this price. If you look around on the net, you will see this lens gets nothing but rave reviews and it consistently rated higher than it's competitors costing over twice as much. If you're looking for a wide angle lens BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Johncal

customer_reviews.title: Good on daylight conditions
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginer on DSLR photography so I can't give a technical review but I can share my personal experience. The pictures on a day light are beatiful. I bought it to take landscape pictures and on daylight conditions the pictures were up to my spectations, but when I tried to take pictures in the middle of the forest it was useless (the light conditions were similar to indoor). I tried higher ISO and lower F-stops but the pictures were too noisy, I didn't even try taking pictures on low light. Maybe with a tripod I could had lowered the shooter speed enought to get good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Joselyn P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Interior Shots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so that I could start up my Real Estate Photography business, desperately needed a wide angle lens! I have only had one chance to use it, but I'm really happy that I bought it. I had photographed a friend's house with the standard camera lens and it was very difficult to shoot the entire room. When I did my first job with this lens, it was so easy to get the composition that I wanted. Even though I have only used it once, it suited my needs more than I thought it would, and I didn't have any problems with it being too slow or blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Real Estate photography
customer_reviews.text: Loving this lens. Great for interior shots for Real Estate photography - especially interiors and wide angle view shots of the exterior of the house. Bought this with the lens hood and Tiffen UV filter.
customer_reviews.author: Mako

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens for everyday daytime use. If you want to use it for astrophotography, not so easy.
customer_reviews.text: Good lens, lightweight, nice extra-wide angle, with minimal distortion. If you want to use it for night-time shots, it's "focus-by-wire." No "infinity" setting. You hold down the shutter button partway, and you turn the focus ring with your other hand. And you turn, and you turn, and you turn... Or you set a flashlight down about 20-30 ft away from you, and focus to the flashlight--then, switch to manual focus.
customer_reviews.author: Hy D. Tran

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR LANDSCAPE
customer_reviews.text: You really cannot beat the price for a wide angle crop sensor lens. Since I use this outside for landscapes, I really don't need the wide open aperture. If you are doing interiors where there is less light and a need for the smaller f-stop, you might want to purchase the Canon EF-S 10-20mm, but this thing is a steal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: ... when I'm 2ft away from the camera and I LOVE the wide angle effect that it does
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens almost only for taking videos when I'm 2ft away from the camera and I LOVE the wide angle effect that it does. Also without going into details this lens is awesome for all close up shots and I almost exclusively use it for selfie shots and shots with me standing right in front of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Late To The Table (Youtube)Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. I use it a LOT more than I thought I would, due to the low weight, compact size and rugged construction. I get lots of nice landscape shots with it. Do pay attention to framing. When you use such a wide angle, things tend to distort around the edges, which is especially apparent when there are buildings with straight lines that end up looking crooked. To fix this, make sure to point directly at the horizon when shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: A must have in your collection! Ever have the moment of, "Dang, wish I could zoom out more." This will remedy (basically) all those moments. As others have said, it is perfect for doing some interior and architectural shots.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Zoom Lenses I've Ever Purchased
customer_reviews.text: It's rare to find quality this good in a zoom lens this cheap. I've had mine for the better part of a year now and I absolutely love it! It's in its element outdoors shooting beautiful landscapes, buildings, large groups of friends; or you can set it up at night for headlight trails, star trails, and so on. Images are consistently sharp throughout its zoom and aperture range. Simply put, this lens has allowed me to get some really amazing shots that just wouldn't have been possible with any other lens that doesn't cost at least twice as much. Definitely worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality. You will get some distortion.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item because the edge distortion was a little bit too much for me. But I think it was my expectations that were out of whack not the product. You're not going to get this level of wide-angle without some distortion in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: KC Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best lens I have a must have for travelers and vloggers
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a must have in any bag for travelers, vloggers or real estate photographers. I do some hobby vlogging, I travel a lot and I do real estate/contractor portfolio photography on the side. I've enjoyed using this lens thoroughly and it has upped my photography game.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin H

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this lens! It is a must for photographers, especially ones taking pictures of cityscapes. I bought it before going to NYC and my pictures turned out beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Nehls

customer_reviews.title: I have have not given it a full workout but so far it is easy to use and has given me good results
customer_reviews.text: I am taking a photography course to increase my understanding and versatility in taking photographs. Since I am new to this type of lens, I have have not given it a full workout but so far it is easy to use and has given me good results. I can not imagine that the lenses that cost up to $2000 can be any better to the amateur photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a 4.5 star product, IMHO. There is a lot of value here for the money. I have a more expensive Tamron wide angle lens that I have been using, but it always had quite a lot of distortion. You will always experience some distortion in wide angle lenses, but it is minimized in this lens. I use it quite a lot. I experimented using it to take team shots of my son's soccer team with great results. This isn't a sports lens, nor is it great for portraits, but it is a great value buy to round out your lens collection.
customer_reviews.author: Tampa_Dude

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for those not looking to break the bank.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for those not looking to break the bank with 10-22 lens. We use it for real estate and the wide angle is perfect for what we need. I did all the research on the 10-18 vs the 10-22 and could not justify the extra expense. Yes, you can get into the why the 10-22 is a better lens but it was a strictly business decision. For what we use it for worrying about chromatic aberration doesn't pay the bills.
customer_reviews.author: Rey Casanova

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Landscape Wide Angle Lens
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic field of view and excellent sharpness!!! Great value for $250. I included pictures showing the difference between by stock lens and the wide angle lens for a comparison of the field of view.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Whetzel

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have Lens for Capturing Everything Your Eye Sees!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is now my favorite of the ones that I own. I love being able to take landscapes and capture everything that I see in front of my eye thanks to the wider focal length. I've hardly taken it off my camera body since receiving it--it is my go-to lens.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Toolan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wide angle lens
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a wide lens for my camera and after doing my homework I decided to pull the trigger with this one, just before going on a family trip to the beach. I am amazed at the pictures I took! Most of the time I'm shooting at 10mm or somewhere between 10 and 14mm. I rarely go beyond that, but even then every image is crystal clear. So much light enters this lens that I find myself under exposing most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Curiel Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Really love the real estate shots I get with this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens for use to take pictures of completed projects for my windows and door business. Such great quality shots and really easy to use. I also use this lens for video blogging as well when demoing installations and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Roy Chappell  V

customer_reviews.title: A must for youtubers, landlords, and wide angle photographers/video makers
customer_reviews.text: This lens is absolutely a joy to use. Super wide, clear and crisp, vibrant images. STM is fantastic and the IS is great for filming. Truly a versatile lens worth the value and a must have for young-film makers/youtubers. Works great with the Cannon 70D or 80D. My advertisement for a room instantly skyrocketed the value from 750$/mth to 950$/mth by taking some nice photos and decorating the room!
customer_reviews.author: Luther Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great vlogging lens!
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for blogging. Really wide angle allows for good close up video without your face taking up the whole frame. Landscape photos look ok, but this lens doesn't really perform will in low light or long exposure shots. Fortunately I use it mostly for vid or during the day, so it works really well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very happy to get a Canon lens for this price point. Clear images- by far better quality than the 18-55 and the 75-300 lenses that come with some bodies.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Adams

customer_reviews.title: Best video/real estate lens ever
customer_reviews.text: Best video/real estate lens ever. Clear, quiet, perfect focus. Dropped mine a number of times already. Still works great. Awesome piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: The lens auto focus failed just after one year. ...
customer_reviews.text: The lens auto focus failed just after one year. If you buy this, be sure to get a multi-year protection plan.
customer_reviews.author: Manitou

customer_reviews.title: Great for vlogging and photography but....
customer_reviews.text: If you're vlogging, this is your lens. Does create a distortion though, which I believe adds onto the quirkiness of youtube and makes for great pictures. Just be aware of that when buying.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Business equipment is too important
customer_reviews.text: I had the lens less than one month and the focusing went out. Will not be buying any camera equipment from Amazon again. For the professional photographer, we are better off buying from reputable photography stores than 3rd party sellers.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price but awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with the quality of the lens. I haven't had a chance to try it out yet other than a quick shot of some trees but the image looked pretty sharp and the lens worked great on my Canon EOS Rebel T100.
customer_reviews.author: K V

customer_reviews.title: Good but now great...still love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens a lot! However it is not the sharpest and has some issues with backlight, but it’s STM focusing is amazing and it is super light and simple to use! Get it. If you want something sharper get the Tokina 11-20mm 2.8
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mayeda

customer_reviews.title: Treat yourself! This is a nice lens!!
customer_reviews.text: This a seriously nice lens. I prefer it over my 17-40mm L series. Nice upgrade for any rebel camera
customer_reviews.author: alix boulard

customer_reviews.title: What a great sharp lens!!
customer_reviews.text: Regardless if there's low light, this inexpensive lens can really keep up with the pro lens!
customer_reviews.author: Trudy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love my Canon's
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon, however it needs a better explanation of minimum focusing distance. It varies greatly depending upon the zoom strength. Otherwise it works great, it's quick, quite and concise.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. Bleier

customer_reviews.title: Affordable lens that takes great photos
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely happy with this purchase! I went on a trip to northern Arizona and wanted a good wide angle lens to capture Antelope Canyon and Horseshoe Bend. I also needed it to be in budget since I also had a trip to pay for. Thanks to this lens I got some amazing photos! This might just be my go to lens from here on out. You definitely get your moneys worth with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: darci sacco

customer_reviews.title: Great Wide angle Lens for Crop Sensor
customer_reviews.text: Canon Ef-s 10-18mm f/4.5-5.6 IS STM Lens, is Great on Crop Sensor Cameras, I've used on Canon 60d, and give you wide angle Look, that's what a crop sensor needs, plus Image Stabilization on the lens works good on Videos, It's not a prime but is best that you can get. Additional detail: is really light nice to travel and easy to do street walking photography. Good Quality Pictures I Recommend this lens...
customer_reviews.author: SherwinChaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Wide Angle
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. No complaints on quality of images based on the cost. If you aren't a perfectionist this will be an amazing purchase if you've never had a wide angle lens.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Errico

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Modest price.
customer_reviews.text: This lens does everything that I expected from a modestly priced lens. I'm not a professional photographer. I'm an amateur who wants to be prepared for occasions when a wide angle lens is needed. This is a quality product that satisfies my needs well.
customer_reviews.author: Mann D.

customer_reviews.title: This is a no-brainer
customer_reviews.text: If you like the 50mm/f1.8, you should like this one as well. Both are low-cost lens with superb optical quality. The plastic construction might feel cheap but it also has the advantage of being light weight. It is not as fast as Canon 10-22mm and Tokina 11-16mm but this disadvantage in low light situation is compensated by image stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great vlogging lens!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this lens. It will be perfect for pictures in Alaska and vlogs.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara B.

customer_reviews.title: This Lens is Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This lens works wonderful on my Canon T6i. I am very pleased with the results. Here are some photos from my recent trip to Maui. It produces great quality photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: This lens takes amazing landscape pictures! I bought it for real estate photography after hearing good reviews about it. It works well, but I did have the "green blob" under certain light fixtures that other people have talked about. It isn't super noticeable and I'll continue to use it. Pictures of the backyard and front yard look fantastic. For the price, it's amazing! I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two big problems for real estate photography
customer_reviews.text: I am a real estate photographer, and I had 2 big problems with this lens. Gave it 3 stars because it was nice and sharp especially outdoors, but I had too much ghosting on interior photos, and distortion along the right side. Always on a tripod, and always f9-f10. See the photos below. I had to return it. Going to try a 10-22mm for the second time. The first time I got a used one and it was soft on the right side. I know they are fantastic, I edit photos everyday taken from an 8 year old 10-22mm. Maybe I'll have better luck next time. *Photo 1- green ghosting in mirror *Photo 2- distortion on lower right side
customer_reviews.author: A.H.

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: A million times better than the lenses my camera came with: 18-55. And the wide image is soooo good! It is making a huge difference for not a ridiculous amount of money.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Z.

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. Its made my interior photography so much better. I didn't realize the lens size was 67 vs. the 58 of my other lenses, so I bought the wrong filters. But that was my fault. You cant get a lens like this for a price like this.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for real estate listing. Shows the room much better than a regular lense. Very happy with it even though it’s pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Beet rolls

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens and a great price. I use this lens mostly for vlogging and it gets me the wide shots I want
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lens for Realtor Listings
customer_reviews.text: Lens was just the ticket to improve interior photos of homes plus it is great for landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for home sale (real estate) photography
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for home sale (real estate) photography. Able to get the whole room in a single frame. My unit, though, has one small area that seems defective. Every photo has a small dark spot in the exact same place in every photo. I think it's the lens, because it doesn't happen with my other lenses. That kinda sucks for me, but otherwise it's a great lens. Wondering if I should return it and ask for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Rajeev Goel

customer_reviews.title: Best lenses I had!
customer_reviews.text: Great leanses! Perfect for taking wide angle views! Great price!
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite lens! It’s great for traveling and landscape photography, but I also love it for portraits. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Lens.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens for shooting interiors for Real Estate Photography, however I've found that I pickup my Canon 60D over the 5d Mark III just to use this lens. I like the look of wide angle sometimes. I'll be honest that I'm not that much of a pixel peeper and haven't really gone too crazy looking at the image quality and sharpness. I'll post an update once I look into this a little more. So far I'd say the quality is on point and I haven't had any of the ghosting issues other have talked about. The price was my favorite part!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Slippey

customer_reviews.title: Solid lens, and undeniably a great value, but imperfect.
customer_reviews.text: Solid lens, and undeniably a great value, but imperfect. Very noticeable darkness in the corners at 10mm. Going back to the 10-22mm.
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoVagabond

customer_reviews.title: This is a great addition to my photo equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to my photo equipment. I used it the day it arrived and have taken some great pix.
customer_reviews.author: WAE

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it right MEOW!
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers before me - this lens is AWESOME! I'm not a pro - so the aberrations at the edges don't bother me - but the total image quality is superb. I wish I purchased this sooner. Auto focus is somewhat quiet and the stabilization is great.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha NinjaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Secret weapon
customer_reviews.text: A surprisingly good lens for the price, light weight, focuses and zooms well. It will replace the superwide I was previously using on my APS-C DSLR's. It will be especially useful for video on my 80D, which has excellent continuous autofocus in live view mode..
customer_reviews.author: bluesdivasphotos

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens it is very nice to shoot with and the quality is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Fancy

customer_reviews.title: My favorite lens!
customer_reviews.text: I take photos as just a light hobby so my review is more based on how my photos look than the specifics of the lens. I personally love this lens! We travel often and I have been looking for a lens that captures the full feel of the place I’m photographing and this lens has helped me do that! I can get more background while also getting personal shots.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Well satisfied with this critter.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great little lens for the price. I have seen some artifacts on some night time shots but it was isolated and mostly due to the available light at the time. I would not hesitate to recommend this lens to friends that don't have or care to shell out the bucks for the high end lens. I'm quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: TBigATC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens. Build quality does feel cheap and "plasticky" ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens. Build quality does feel cheap and "plasticky" as others have suggested however, the picture quality is definitely worth the value. As a hobbyist, I was in the market for an affordable wide-angle lens, and chose this over the Tokina because of the IS feature.
customer_reviews.author: Liem Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Totally love this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens to shoot interior photos of our home to sell it by owner. I did my research prior to the purchase and am so thrilled to have added this lens to my camera bag. The 12mm setting seems to be the best for me. The photos are going to sell our home effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Open wide!
customer_reviews.text: This lense is what I expected and much more! The quality is typical Canon product, in order words excellent. The only negative is "shadow" when you use the camera built in flash, the picture show a shadow due to the flash and wide lens design otherwise it takes wonderful wide angle pictures. I also like that it's very light.
customer_reviews.author: Dino Del Toro

customer_reviews.title: Solid art lens with higher grade optics than many other similar lenses of a higher price. Best Buy Ultrawide.
customer_reviews.text: A solid art lens that lends itself to any amount of fun, from Vlog-style filming, to street photography, et cetera, Clean shooter at extreme close range, with incredibly well engineered glass for the price. One step below L-class lenses, but yards ahead of many other ultrawides in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wide angle zoom!
customer_reviews.text: Great for capturing a wide group in a close space.
customer_reviews.author: Anne C. Morris

product_meta.title: Canon EF-S 10-18mm f/4.5-5.6 IS STM Lens
product_meta.description:
Style:Lens OnlyThe EF-S 10-18mm f 4.5-5.6 IS STM lens combines optical excellence with cutting-edge performance, providing an ultra-wide angle of view in a compact, portable package, perfect for EOS cameras with an APS-C sensor. It has a 4 group optical zoom system and includes a large-diameter element, an aspherical lens element, a UD lens element and enhanced lens coatings for high-contrast, high-resolution images with minimal glare and aberration. A circular, 7-blade aperture helps ensure fine background blur and the Canon Optical Image Stabilizer system provides up to four equivalent stops of shake correction. The lens has a stepping motor STM and a refined focus mechanism for smooth and continuous AF during video recording. It also has a rear focusing system, plus a high speed CPU and improved AF algorithm for high-speed AF and offers full-time manual focus for quick adjustments. The EF-S 10-18mm f 4.5-5.6 IS STM delivers reliable, speedy and quiet wide-angle performance, making it an ideal lens for everyday photography, travel, stills and video recording.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

EF-S 10–18MM F/4.5–5.6 IS STM
The EF-S 10–18mm f/4.5–5.6 IS STM lens combines optical excellence with cutting-edge performance, providing an ultra-wide angle of view in a compact, portable package, perfect for EOS cameras with an APS-C sensor. It has a 4 group optical zoom system and includes a large-diameter element, an aspherical lens element, a UD lens element and enhanced lens coatings for high-contrast, high-resolution images with minimal glare and aberration. A circular, 7-blade aperture helps ensure fine background blur and the Canon Optical Image Stabilizer system provides up to four equivalent stops of shake correction. The lens has a stepping motor (STM) and a refined focus mechanism for smooth and continuous AF during video recording. It also has a rear focusing system, plus a high speed CPU and improved AF algorithm for high-speed AF; and offers full-time manual focus for quick adjustments. The EF-S 10–18mm f/4.5–5.6 IS STM delivers reliable, speedy and quiet wide-angle performance, making it an ideal lens for everyday photography, travel, stills and video recording.

SPECIFICATIONS
 * Focal Length & Maximum Aperture: 10–18mm 1:4.5–5.6
 * Lens Construction: 14 elements in 11 groups
 * Diagonal Angle of View: 107°30' – 74°20'
 * Focus Adjustment: Rear focus system 
 * Closest Focusing Distance: 0.72 ft. / 0.22m
 * Filter Size: 67mm diameter 
 * Max Diameter x Length, Weight: 2.9 x 2.8 inches, approx. 8.5 oz. / 74.6 x 72.0mm, approx. 240g

MTF CHARTS
feature_bullets: EF S ultra wide zoom lens. Drive System Lead screw and rack system driven by stepping motor
Stepping motor for noise free video shooting
Focal Length and Maximum Aperture: 10 18 millimeter,1:4.5 5.6
